description: Latin aberrō (“go astray; err”), from ab (“from, away from”) +‎ errō (“stray”).

verbs.description: aberr (third-person singular simple present aberrs, present participle aberring, simple past and past participle aberred)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) To go astray; to err. [Attested from the mid 16th century until the mid 17th century.]
(transitive, rare) Distort; aberrate. [First attested in the late 19th century.]
